 If you take this feat after you have passed the previously stated levels, you instead gain 1 additional D-Rank if passed 5th level, 1 additional C-Rank if passed 9th level, and one additional B-Rank is passed 13th level

name: Ninshou Theorist
description:
You study the Ninshou arts, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in the Ninshou skill. 
 Over the course of a short rest, you attempt to theorize on how to manipulate the concept of a jutsu you know to bend it to your will. Make an Intelligence (Ninshou) check vs a DC (15 + The rank of the jutsu, D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5). On a success, until your next rest, the selected jutsu is always under one of the following Efficient moldings from the Ninjutsu Specialist Class. This does not increase the cost of the jutsu by the Efficient molding costs as seen in the Ninjutsu Specialist Class. Once selected this cannot be undone until you complete your next rest.;
 Careful Ninjutsu (Max of 3 creatures.)
 Distant Ninjutsu
 Piercing Ninjutsu 
 Tenacious Ninjutsu
 Widened Ninjutsu

name: Water Release Expert
description:
You can feel every droplet of water and every molecule of chakra flowing within each drop. You can squeeze efficiency out of every drop. When casting a Ninjutsu with the water release keyword, you gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When you are near a sufficient source of water that can be used to reduce the cost of the given jutsu cast, reduce the cost by 3, instead of 2.
 When a ninjutsu you cast with the water release keyword deals damage to at least one creature, you can choose to leave behind a small source of water within 5ft of one of the affected creature(s). The source of water can be used to activate effects that requires a sufficient source of water no more than once, which then drains the water source.

name: Wind Release Expert
description:
Your mastery with wind natured chakra is so great, that with but a thought, you can create the sharpest blade made exclusively from wind. 
 When casting a Ninjutsu with the wind release keyword, you gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When you would trigger a Swirl effect, increase the radius by +5 feet.
 Creatures cannot have advantage on saving throws vs Ninjutsu you cast with the Wind release keyword.

name: Storing Seal Soul
description:
You have created a minor pocket dimension that follows you, that you can use to store item inside. You gain the following Benefits; 
 You manifest a pocket dimension that you can interact with. This pocket dimension has a maximum bulk limit of 25.
 As a bonus action you can store any item you are holding or wearing into the pocket dimension.
 As a bonus action you can retrieve any item stored within the pocket dimension.
 If you are reduced to 0 Hit points, all items in your pocket dimension are expelled and fall occupying random spaced within 10 feet of you.
 Another creature who is aware of your Pocket dimension can cast a jutsu with the Fuinjutsu keyword targeting you and make an Intelligence (Ninshou) check vs your Intelligence or Constitution (Ninshou) check. On a success, they tear open your pocket dimension pulling out any item they are looking for.
 Taijutsu Feats

name: Assassins Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Shadows either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in Kunai, Shuriken, and Senbon, if you were not already. These Weapons become known as Assassin Weapons.
 When you would deal damage with an Assassin Weapon as a result of a weapon attack or Bukijutsu you cast, once per turn, you can inflict the Bleeding condition on a target creature.
 You cannot be disarmed of your Assassin Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using an Assassin weapon, you can in place of attacks made with said action, make an Assassination Attack. Assassination attacks are weapon attacks that deal the maximum possible damage with the chosen weapon.

name: Bukijutsu Archivist
description:
Your Focus in the heat of Combat and mastery of bukijutsu, allow you weave weapon arts together with much greater skill. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 You learn an additional bukijutsu that you qualify for. This does not count against your Jutsu Known. 
 The next time you would hit 5th, 9th, or 13th level, you learn one additional bukijutsu of 1 rank lower than your highest known jutsu rank.
 If you take this feat after you have passed the previously stated levels, you instead gain 1 additional D-Rank if passed 5th level, 1 additional C-Rank if passed 9th level, and one additional B-Rank if passed 13th level.

name: Bullseye Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Bows either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in one set of equipment as these weapons become known as Bullseye Weapons.
 Short Bows, Long Bows & Heavy Jacket
 Light Crossbows, Heavy Crossbows & Heavy Jacket
 Weapon attacks from a Bullseye Weapon ignores structures and constructs that would intercept the damage dealt, dealing damage directly to the target creature(s).
 You cannot be disarmed of your Bullseye Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using a Bullseye weapon you can knock 2 shots instead of one. For the remainder of this turn, ranged weapon attacks you make with your Bullseye Weapon doubles its weapon damage die. Reduce your ammunition die by one step, instead of rolling.

name: Dragon Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Dragons either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Dragon Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu you know, that requires the Dragon Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu you know, that requires you to make no more than two attacks become Dragon Fist Taijutsu. Dragon Fist Taijutsu you cast gains the Hungry Dragon trait. 
 Hungry Dragon. Once per casting, when you deal your [Unarmed Damage] to a hostile creature, you steal a fraction of their chakra. You regain Temporary Chakra points equal to half the result of one of your [Unarmed Damage] die rolled (if more than 1.). This temporary Chakra lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Drunken Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Monks of inebriation either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Drunken Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Drunken Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Drunken Fist Taijutsu. Drunken Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Gin & Tonic trait.
 Gin & Tonic. Once per casting, when you deal your [Unarmed Damage] to a hostile creature, you are able to slip a taste of a special drink enhancing the unpredictability of your attacks. Until the beginning of your next turn, creatures within 10 feet of you cannot gain feature, jutsu or trait-based bonuses to their melee attack rolls targeting you.

name: Efficient Breathing
description:
You have begun to master the use of the Heavenly Breaths and have learned to manage the stress and strain it causes your body. You gain the following benefits; 
 You no longer need to pay chakra to maintain concentration of any Taijutsu with the Heavenly Breath name. 
 You reduce the cost of Taijutsu with the Heavenly Breath name by an amount equal to its rank (D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5).
 You can cast a Taijutsu with the Heavenly Breath name using either an action, Bonus action or Reaction on your turn, ignoring its listed casting time.
 The benefits of Taijutsu with the Heavenly Breath can apply to your unarmed and weapon attacks, once per turn.

name: Empowered Bukijutsu
description:
You learn to empower your Bukijutsu with technique and refined skill, you gain the following benefits:
 When you cast a bukijutsu you can increase your [Weapons Damage] die by 1 step. (d4>d6>d8>d10>d12) 
 When a creature would make a saving throw to resist a bukijutsu you cast; If they fail by 5 or more, they take double damage.
 When you would make a Constitution (Chakra control) check to maintain concentration on a Bukijutsu you cast, you can add 1d4 to the result of the check.

name: Empowered Taijutsu
description:
You learn to empower your Taijutsu with more elegant technique, you gain the following benefits:
 When you cast a taijutsu as an action, you can choose to also spend your bonus action. If you do, you deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus, up to three times
 When you cast a taijutsu with the Combo or Finisher keyword, reduce the cost by an amount equal to its rank (D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5). Multiple effects with rank-based reduction do not stack.
 When you would make a Constitution (Chakra control) check to maintain concentration on a Taijutsu you cast, you can make a Martial Arts check instead, using your Taijutsu ability modifier.

name: Fighting Stylist
description:
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 Choose one of the Fighting Stances from Chapter 13.
 You can select this feat multiple times. You can't take a Fighting Stance option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

name: Frog Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Land of Swamps either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Frog Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu, you know that requires the Frog Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Frog Fist Taijutsu. Frog Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Ribbit trait. 
 Ribbit. Once per casting, when your Taijutsu attacks damage is intercepted by a structure or construct, you ignore those structures and constructs dealing damage as normal to the original target.

name: Iron Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Masters of brawling and metal bending fists, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Iron Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8. If you have Combat Bracers this instead becomes 1d10 if Strength is your Taijutsu ability score.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Iron Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Iron Fist Taijutsu. Iron Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Metal trait. 
 Metal. Once per casting, when dealing damage to a creature with Armor based DR (Damage reduction), you can punch through their Armor. By spending your Bonus action as part of the jutsu's casting, you can reduce their Armor based DR by an amount equal to the result of one of your [Unarmed Damage] die. This Armor reduction lasts until the affected creature spends an action adjusting themselves.

name: Lancer Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Reeds either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in one set of equipment as these weapons become known as Lance Weapons.
 Spears, Naginata & Battle Armor
 Chained Spear, Sasumata & Battle Armor
 Lance Weapons gain the Deadly 2 and increase their rank of Reach by +1. 
 You cannot be disarmed of your Lance Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using a Lance weapon, you can in place of one of the attacks made with said action, make a Lance Attack. Lance Attacks are weapon attacks that target all creatures in a cone directly in front of you with a length equal to your weapons range as your repeated stab forward, comparing the single attack roll with all targets AC, dealing weapon damage as normal.

name: Light Step Mastery
description:
You've mastered the art of fighting while minimally armored, treating combat as an elegant dance. While you are wearing no armor, you gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 Whenever an attack roll misses you, you may move 5 feet without triggering attacks of opportunity.
 Once per turn, when a creature misses you with an attack, your next attack against them deals an additional 1d8 damage.
 When you take the dash action, you may move an additional +10 feet.
 When a creature misses you with an attack, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC, up to a maximum of +2, until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Lion Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Land of Kings, either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Lion Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8. This becomes a d10 against a creature with ranks of Fear
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Lion Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Lion Fist Taijutsu. Lion Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Regal trait.
 Regal. Once per casting, when you would deal damage to a hostile creature with ranks of any Mental condition, you gain a +2 bonus to your next saving throw before the beginning of your next turn.

name: Ninja Slayer
description:
You have practiced techniques useful in melee combat against Shinobi Ninjutsu & Genjutsu, gaining the following benefits:
 When a creature within your weapons range would casts a Ninjutsu or Genjutsu, you can use your reaction to make an attack of opportunity using your weapon targeting the triggering creature.
 When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a Jutsu, that creature has disadvantage on skill checks made to maintain concentration.
 You have advantage on saving throws against Ninjutsu & Genjutsu cast by creatures within 10 feet of you.

name: Rabbit Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Warrior priestesses from the Land of Hops either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Rabbit Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Rabbit Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Rabbit Fist Taijutsu. Rabbit Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the High Jump Kick trait.
 High Jump Kick. Once per casting, you can move up to 20 feet in any direction. If you would end your movement within 5 feet of a creature who was not affected by this jutsu's casting, you immediately make 1 Unarmed strike against them.

name: Raider Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of War either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in one set of equipment as these weapons become known as Raid Weapons.
 Hand Axe, Great Axe & Battle Coat
 Tekko, War Club & Battle Coat
 Raid Weapons gain the Disarm, Heavy and Winding weapon properties. Raid Weapons with the Heavy property ignores the Strength ability score requirement of the property.
 You cannot be disarmed of your Raid Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using a Raid weapon, you can in place one of the attacks made with said action, make a Raiding Attack. Raiding Attacks are weapon attacks that when you deal damage to a creature wearing armor, you reduce their AC by 1 and their armor's Damage reduction by 2, until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Reaper Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Graves either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in one set of equipment as these weapons become known as Reaper Weapons.
 Kama, Kusarigama, Scythe & Shinobi Jacket.
 Triple-Bladed Scythe & Synthetic Weave.
 Reaper Weapons increase their Deadly rank by +2 and their Critical rank by +1.
 You cannot be disarmed of Reaper Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using a Reaper weapon, in place of one attack made with your attack action you can make a Reaping Attack. Reaping Attacks are weapon attacks that inflict one rank of Lacerated on a successful hit that deals weapon damage to a creature's hit points.

name: Ronin Training
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the land of Iron either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in one set of equipment as these weapons become known as Ronin Weapons.
 Hand Crossbow, Chokuto & Ronin Armor.
 Short Bow, Katana & Ronin Armor.
 Long Bow, Tachi & Ronin Armor.
 Ronin Weapons gain Blocking 1, Lethal +1 and Multiattack weapon properties.
 You cannot be disarmed of your Ronin Weapon and they cannot be broken while you are wielding them.
 When you take the attack action using a Ronin Weapon, in place of one attack made with your attack action you can make a Ronin Attack. Ronin Attacks are weapon attacks that deal more damage the less armor a creature has. On a hit against a creature with medium armor, deal an additional 1d4 damage. On a hit against a creature with Chakra armor, deal an additional 1d6 damage. On a hit against a creature with Light armor, deal an additional 1d8 damage. On a hit against a creature with no armor, deal an additional 1d10 damage.

name: Serpent Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the serpent masters in the land of grass, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Serpent Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Serpent Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Serpent Fist Taijutsu. Serpent Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Rattling trait.
 Rattling. When a hostile creature would trigger an attack of opportunity from you, cast a jutsu that requires handsigns within 5ft of you or stand up from prone while adjacent to you, you can cast this jutsu, as a reaction.

name: Shinobi Sentinel
description:
You've mastered techniques to take advantage of every drop in any enemy's guard; in tight spaces you are indomitable. While you are wielding a melee weapon with which you are proficient, you gain the following benefits:
 When you hit a creature with an attack of opportunity, the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.
 Creatures within 5 feet of you provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.
 If a creature makes an attack of opportunity against you, you can as a reaction, make an attack of opportunity against them.

name: Silent Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Land of Silence either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Silent Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8. If you have Iron Claws this instead becomes 1d10 if Dexterity is your Taijutsu ability modifier.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Silent Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Silent Fist Taijutsu. Silent Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Echo trait.
 Echo. Once per casting, when you deal [Unarmed Damage] to a creature, you leave an Echo of your strike, recording the damage dice rolled. If the affected creature would attempt to attack or cast a jutsu that would be harmful to another creature before the beginning of your next turn, you can trigger this echo. Reroll the damage die of your echoed strike and select the two highest dice results, dealing

name: Taijutsu Archivist
description:
Your Focus in the heat of Combat and mastery of Martial arts, allow you weave taijutsu together with much greater skill. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You learn an additional taijutsu that you qualify for. This does not count against your Jutsu Known. 
 The next time you would hit 5th, 9th, or 13th level, you learn one additional Taijutsu of 1 rank lower than your highest known jutsu rank
 If you take this feat after you have passed the previously stated levels, you instead gain 1 additional D-Rank if passed 5th level, 1 additional C-Rank if passed 9th level, and one additional B-Rank if passed 13th level.

name: Taijutsu Expertise
description:
Your Focus in the heat of Combat and mastery of the martial arts, allow you to fight with much greater efficiency. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 Select one between Taijutsu or Bukijutsu. You may use Dexterity instead of Strength as your Taijutsu Modifier when casting the chosen jutsu type.
 You may use Dexterity instead of Strength for your Unarmed Attack and damage rolls.
 You may use Dexterity when making a Martial Arts Checks.
 You may take this feat again, select the jutsu type you didn't select the first time.

name: Weapon Expert
description:
You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice.
 Select one weapon, with which you are proficient. Once per turn, when you roll damage for the chosen weapon, you can reroll its damage, using either total.
 Once per turn, when you would cast a Bukijutsu using a weapon, your weapon increases its weapon damage die by +1.

name: Weapon Mastery
description:
You have practiced extensively with a single weapon, expanding your capabilities with it greatly, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 Select one weapon, with which you are proficient. Then select one weapon property from the following list. The chosen weapon gains the chosen weapon property while you are wielding it or increases the rank of the chosen weapon property by +1 while you are wielding it.
 Critical (Max 3)
 Deadly (Max 3)
 Tactical
 Winding
 You can take this feat more than once, picking the same weapon and property, different weapon, different property or different weapon, same property.

name: Wolf Fist Expert
description:
You have trained under the teachings of the Land of Wolves either directly or by descension, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 While you are in the Wolf Fist Stance, your [Unarmed Damage] die becomes a d8.
 Taijutsu you know that requires the Wolf Fist Stance to be cast, and up to two additional Taijutsu that you know, that requires you to make no more than two taijutsu attacks become Wolf Fist Taijutsu. Wolf Fist Taijutsu you cast gain the Howl trait.
 Howl. Once per casting, when you deal [Unarmed Damage] to a creature, all allies within 15 feet of you, excluding yourself are inspired by your aggressive assault, gaining a Xd4 bonus to the next instance of damage dealt to the same creature as the result of a Taijutsu attack, before the beginning of your next turn. (X = your proficiency bonus.)

name: 8-Inner Gates: Seimon
description:
You have begun to master the use of the Eight Inner Gates. A legendary technique designed to release the limits on a user's chakra pathways, thus increasing their physical strength and speed. You learn to unlock 3 of such Inner gates; Kaimon, Kyumon and Seimon. Unlocking each gate grants additional benefits in addition to the benefits granted by the previous gate activated. Gates cannot be unlocked out of order. Activating each Inner Gate costs an action, Bonus action or reaction on your turn.
 While you are gaining the benefit of any Gate you cannot cast or maintain the concentration on any Ninjutsu or Genjutsu.
 Any Gate you activate can only remain active for 1 minute or until you deactivate it. You must complete a rest to gain the benefit of any Gate granted by this feat. If you would attempt to gain the benefit of a Gate granted by this feat a second time without taking a rest, you instead must spend 2 hit die to do so, which are not recovered until you complete a full-rest. When you would end the activation of or be forced to end any 8-Inner gate, you gain all Ranks of any Fatigue. You lose one ranks of Fatigue every 1 hour; 
 Kaimon. 
 Str: +2
 Speed: +15
 +1 Rank of Fatigue
 Kyumon. 
 Str: +2
 Speed: +15
 Spend 2 Hit Die, regaining the result. This can only be used once per short rest.
 +2 Rank of Fatigue
 Seimon. 
 Str: +4
 Speed: +10
 AC: +1
 +2 Rank(s) of Fatigue.

name: 8-Inner Gates: Keimon
preRequisite: 8-Inner Gates: Seimon, Taijutsu Ability Score of 18+, Level 10+
description:
You have learned more masterful technique of the Eight Inner Gates, learning to unlock 3 more powerful gates of Inner power; Shomon, Tomon and Keimon. 
 You must currently be gaining the benefit of Seimon, in order to activate Shomon.
 You must complete a rest to gain the benefit of any Gate granted by this feat a second time. If you would attempt to gain the benefit of a Gate granted by this feat a second time without taking a rest, you instead must spend 2 hit die to do so, which are not recovered until you complete a full-rest. When you would end the activation of or be forced to end any 8-Inner gate, you gain all Ranks of any Fatigue and Weakened listed. After ending any gate granted by this feature, you lose one rank of Fatigue every 1 hour; 
 Shomon. 
 Str: +2
 Con: +2
 Speed: +10
 +2 Rank of Fatigue
 Tomon. 
 Str: +4
 Speed: +10
 AC: +1
 Extra action.
 +1 Rank of Fatigue
 Keimon. 
 Str: +4
 Con: +2
 Spend 2 hit Dice, regaining the result. This can only be used once per short rest.
 +2 Rank(s) of Fatigue.

name: 8-Inner Gates: Shimon
preRequisite: 8-Inner Gates: Keimon, Taijutsu Ability Score of 20+, Level 16+
description:
You have become a master of the Eight Inner Gates, unlocking the final 2 gates; Kyomon and Shimon 
 You must currently be gaining the benefit of Keimon, in order to activate Kyomon.
 You must complete a rest to gain the benefit of any Gate granted by this feat a second time. If you would attempt to gain the benefit of a Gate granted by this feat a second time without taking a rest, you instead must spend 2 hit die to do so, which are not recovered until you complete a full-rest. When you would end the activation of or be forced to end any 8-Inner gate, you gain all Ranks of any Fatigue and Weakened listed. After ending any gate granted by this feature, you lose one rank of Fatigue every 24 hours; 
 Kyomon. 
 Str: +6
 AC: +1
 +2 Rank of Fatigue
 Shimon. 
 Str: +6
 Con: +2
 Triple Speed.
 AC: +2
 Extra action.
 You die, slowly turning to dust, which cannot be stopped or prevented. You become unable to be revived by any means.
 Genjutsu Feats

name: Empowered Genjutsu
description:
You learn to empower your Genjutsu with more elaborate illusions. You gain the following benefits:
 When a creature attempts a saving throw to resist a genjutsu you cast on them, you may, as a reaction, spend 10 chakra. If you do, until the end of the current turn, the affected creature rolls a number of d4 equal to the rank of the Genjutsu cast, reducing their saving throw by half the result (Min 1). (D-Rank/C-Rank: 1, 
 B-Rank/A-Rank 2, S-Rank: 3)
 Genjutsu you cast that deal damage on a failed save, now deals half damage on a successful save.
 When you would make a Constitution (Chakra Control) check to maintain concentration on a Genjutsu you cast, roll a number of d4 equal to the highest rank of the genjutsu you are currently concentrating on adding half of the result to your check. (Min 1) (D-Rank & C-Rank: 1, B-Rank: & A-Rank: 2, S-Rank: 3)

name: Genjutsu Expertise
description:
Your mastery of the Illusionary Arts, allow you to weave together Genjutsu with much greater efficiency. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You may instead use Charisma instead of Wisdom as your Genjutsu Modifier.
 You may instead use Charisma instead of Wisdom for Illusions Checks.

name: Genjutsu Archivist
description:
Your encyclopedic knowledge of Genjutsu allows you to learn far more Genjutsu than normal. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You learn an additional genjutsu that you qualify for. This does not count against your Jutsu Known. 
 The next time you would hit 5th, 9th, or 13th level, you learn one additional Genjutsu of 1 rank lower than your highest known jutsu rank.
 If you take this feat after you have passed the previously stated levels, you instead gain 1 additional D-Rank if passed 5th level, 1 additional C-Rank if passed 9th level, and one additional B-Rank is passed 13th level.

name: Sensory Specialization
description:
You have begun to specialize in a subset of illusions of your choice. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one Sensory Keyword (Auditory, Visual, Inhaled). You may ignore Hand Seal (HS) requirement for Genjutsu of C-Rank of lower with your chosen keyword.
 You deal additional damage with Genjutsu with your chosen Sensory Keyword, equal to its rank. (D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5) 
 You reduce the chakra cost of Genjutsu with your chosen Sensory keyword by an amount equal to its rank. (D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5). Multiple effects with rank-based reduction do not stack.
 You can take this feat multiple times, each time selecting a different sensory keyword.

name: Psychic Penetration
description:
You have learned to more easily damage your opponents' psyches. You gain the following benefits;
 Genjutsu, you cast ignore resistance to psychic damage.
 When you would roll damage for a genjutsu you cast that deals psychic damage, you can reroll 1's and 2's, keeping the second result.
 When you deal psychic damage to a creature, the select creature gains disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made to end any Sensory or Mental conditions until the end of their next turn.

name: Illusionary Theorist
description:
You study the Illusionary arts, gaining the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
 You gain proficiency in the Illusions skill. 
 Over the course of a short rest, you attempt to theorize on how to manipulate the concept of a genjutsu you know to bend it to your will. Make a Wisdom (Illusions) check vs a DC (15 + The rank of the jutsu, D-Rank: 1, C-Rank: 2, B-Rank: 3, A-Rank: 4, S-Rank: 5). On a success, until your next rest, the selected jutsu is always under one of the following Onijutsu from the Kurama Clan. Once selected this cannot be undone until you complete your next rest.;
 Careful Onijutsu (Max of 3 creatures.)
 Overwhelming Onijutsu
 Tenacious Onijutsu
 Subtle Onijutsu

name: Empathic Expert
description:
You can feel every thought. Every intent. Every passing idea. When casting a Genjutsu that does not deal damage, you gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When you would cast a Genjutsu that targets a single creature, on a failed save, that creatures' movement speed is reduced by 20 feet for the duration.
 When you would cast a Genjutsu that can affect two or more creatures at once, on a failed save, once per turn, all affected creatures take psychic damage whenever one of the other affected creatures take damage of any type, excluding the creature that triggers this effect. The number of psychic damage creatures take is an amount equal to the rank of the jutsu currently affecting them all. (D-Rank: 2d4, C-Rank: 4d4, B-Rank: 6d4, A-Rank: 8d4, S-Rank: 10d4)

name: Psychic Expert
description:
You can feel every migraine. Every headache. Every painful thought. When casting a Genjutsu that deals damage, you gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 Once per turn, one affected creature gains a 1d4 penalty to Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws to resist the next genjutsu they are affected by, if any, until the end of their next turn.
 Once per turn, when a hostile creature would take damage, you can choose to Mentally Scar the creature. A creature who is mentally scarred suffers a -1d4 penalty to end any Mental condition they are under the effects of.
 Genjutsu you cast that requires an attack roll, has their range increased by 20 feet.

name: Psychosis Adept
preRequisite: Pain, Doubled Pain or Unlimited Pain, Level 4+
description:
You've become adept at causing immense psychotic pain to others minds. The advanced techniques you've learned while delving into this specialty has granted you the following benefits:
 The prerequisite jutsu does not cost chakra to maintain concentration, if they do.
 When the prerequisite jutsu deals damage, add your genjutsu ability modifier to the damage rolled.
 If an affected creature would be reduced to 0 hit points as a result of the prerequisite jutsu, you can choose another creature within 10 feet of the original target to target, moving the jutsu to that new target.
 Creatures cannot end the effects of the prerequisite genjutsu on themselves with a jutsu of equal level to it.

name: Psychosis Expert
description:
You've become adept at causing unmatched psychotic trauma to others minds. You gain the following benefits:
 The Pain genjutsu no longer ends when its effect is first applied.
 The Doubled Pain genjutsu increases its damage die by 1 step.
 The Unlimited Pain genjutsu no longer needs a direct line of sight, instead so long as you know the target creatures name, they can hear you, and they are within range, they suffer its effects as normal.

name: Psychosis Master
description:
You've become a master at breaking the minds of your adversaries. Enemies fall into mental coma's when they do battle with you. You gain the following benefits:
 The Pain genjutsu damage die becomes a d6.
 The Doubled Pain genjutsu triggers whenever the target takes damage from a source other than you, once per turn.
 The Unlimited Pain genjutsu can force the target to make an Intelligence or Wisdom saving throw to resist its effects. You decide the saving throw when the jutsu is cast.
 You can concentrate on all 3 prerequisite genjutsu at once If you would end the effect of Doubled Pain as a result of Unlimited Pain you instead maintain concentration on it, while also gaining the upgraded benefits of Unlimited Pain.

name: Lord of Darkness
preRequisite: Puppets of Darkness, Shadow Bite or Weapons of Darkness, Level 4+
description:
Weaving darkness into and out of both your Genjutsu, and the minds of your enemies. The shadows become your friend. The oldest friend one could ask for. You gain the following benefits:
 The prerequisite genjutsu can deal Necrotic damage. Your choice when the jutsu is cast.
 The prerequisite jutsu inflicts 1 rank of Dazzled when it deals damage.
 If you score a critical hit with the prerequisite genjutsu, you can choose to inflict the Confused condition.
 Twice per rest, you can choose to cast one of the prerequisite jutsu as a bonus action. If you could already cast the prerequisite jutsu as a bonus action, you can instead cast it at no action cost.

name: Thought Provoker
description:
Each illusion you manifest, grants you the insight into thoughts and feelings of those you mentally assault. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast that requires an Intelligence saving throw, you can ask one question, telepathically that the target unconsciously answers with 5 words or less.
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast that requires a Wisdom saving throw, you become aware if the target creature feels if they are enjoying the combat or if they feel like they are forced to by another creature, entity or force.
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast that requires a Charisma saving throw, the target finds it difficult to lie or withhold its true feelings verbally until the end of its next turn.

name: Intelligence Drain
description:
Each illusion you manifest, sucks the intelligence and knowledge from their target. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast or you score a successful hit with a Genjutsu attack the target suffers a -1 penalty to their next Intelligence saving throw. This can stack up to -5.
 When a creature would suffer a -1 penalty to their next Intelligence saving throw as a result of this feature, you gain a +1 bonus to your next intelligence saving throw. This can stack up to +5.
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast by 5 or more, you can select one piece of information that you wish to know. If the target knows anything in relation to this piece of information, you become aware of it.

name: Wisdom Drain
description:
Each illusion you manifest, sucks the wit, cunning and wisdom from their target. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast or you score a successful hit with a Genjutsu attack the target suffers a -1 penalty to their next Wisdom saving throw. This can stack up to -5.
 When a creature would suffer a -1 penalty to their next Wisdom saving throw as a result of this feature, you gain a +1 bonus to your next Wisdom saving throw. This can stack up to +5.
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast by 5 or more, you gain one special sense they have as they lose it. You retain this special sense for the remaining duration that the original target would have it. If there was no set duration, it defaults to being 1 minute.

name: Charisma Drain
description:
Each illusion you manifest, sucks the charisma, charm, or intimidating factors from their target. You gain the following benefits:
 Increase your Wisdom or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast or you score a successful hit with a Genjutsu attack the target suffers a -1 penalty to their next Charisma saving throw. This can stack up to -5.
 When a creature would suffer a -1 penalty to their next Charisma saving throw as a result of this feature, you gain a +1 bonus to your next Charisma saving throw. This can stack up to +5.
 When a creature would fail the saving throw of a Genjutsu you cast by 5 or more, they gain vulnerability to the next instance of psychic damage they take.
 Critical Feats

name: Enhanced Critical
description:
Your ability to strike a place with zeal and efficacy grows. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following. Attacks made with the select type have a +1 critical threat range; 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Taijutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting the same or different attack type.

name: Elemental Critical
preRequisite: Level 4+, At least one Nature Affinity
description:
You learn to infuse your nature affinity into your powerful blows. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following. 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Taijutsu attacks
 Once per turn, when you score a critical hit with the chosen attack type, the target creature gains 1 rank of one of the listed conditions based on the Nature affinities you have.
 Earth ' Bruised.
 Wind ' Bleed. 
 Fire ' Burned.
 Water ' Chilled.
 Lightning ' Shocked.
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting a different attack type

name: Cerebral Critical
description:
You learn to bruise both your enemies mind and body in a single strike. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following. 
 Taijutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 Once per turn, when you score a critical hit with the chosen attack type, the target creature gains 1 rank of Concussed.
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting the same or different attack type

name: Bloodthirsty Critical
description:
You fight with reckless abandon, caring not of your own safety. You use your pain to fuel your attacks, causing your enemies even greater pain. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following.; 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Taijutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 When a creature would deal damage to you as the result of a melee attack, you gain a +1 bonus to your critical threat range of the chosen type, no more than twice per round, until the beginning of your next turn.
 When a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause the attack to hit you. You can immediately make a melee weapon attack against that creature. 
 When a creature scores a critical hit against you with an attack, the next attack you make, before the end of your next turn, that hits the creatures who scored a critical hit against you, counts as a critical hit.

name: Combat Seal Weaver
description:
You've practiced making your jutsu more difficult to avoid, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:
 When a creature would make a saving throw against damage from a Ninjutsu or Genjutsu you cast and they would fail the saving throw by 5 or more, increase the damage by the rank of jutsu Cast. (D-Rank: +5, 
 C-Rank: +10, B-Rank: +15, A-Rank: +25, S-Rank: +25).
 When a creature would make a saving throw against a Ninjutsu or Genjutsu you cast that inflicts a condition and they would fail by 5 or more, regardless of the jutsu's effect, the next time they would successfully remake the saving throw or succeed the check needed to remove the condition (if applicable), they instead do not remove the condition.

name: Critical Defense Mastery
description:
While you are wearing heavy armor with which you are proficient, you gain the following benefits:
 Twice per Long Rest, when a hostile creature would score a critical hit against you, you can treat it as a normal hit. You regain one use of this effect, on a short rest.
 You and all allied creatures within 10 feet of you gain 
 5 DR (Damage reduction) vs the damage applied from a Critical hit and when you or allied creature fails a saving throw vs an effect that deals damage.
 When an allied creature within 10 feet of you would be hit by a critical attack, you may spend your reaction to redirect the attack to yourself. You can do this once per initiative.

name: Fanatic
description:
Every blow that hits your enemies make you feel closer to victory, making you shake in excitement. You gain the following benefits:
 Allied creatures within 20 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to their critical threat range so long as they do not have any bonuses to their critical threat range due to another Critical Feat. 
 When you or an allied creature score a critical hit on a creature that reduces their hit points to 0, you gain the Fanatics Rush special action. You can gain this special action, once per round.
 Fanatics Rush. On your turn, you can take this special action to regain 1d6+your proficiency bonus hit points and make one weapon attack.

name: Improved Critical
description:
You learn how to capitalize on the faults in your opponent's guard and control the flow of combat. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following; 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Taijutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 Once per turn, when you score a critical hit with the chosen attack type, you add three additional damage die to the damage dealt.
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting a different attack type.

name: Crippling Critical
description:
When you score a critical hit. You shatter your foes resolve. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one damage type from the following; 
 Bludgeoning
 Piercing
 Earth
 Cold
 Lightning
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting a different damage type. 
 Once per round, when you score a critical hit with the chosen damage type, the target creature must make a Constitution saving throw vs your attack types Save DC (Taijutsu if Weapon/Unarmed attack), being stunned until the beginning of their next turn on a failed save (Or next Elite action, whichever comes first).

name: Terrifying Critical
description:
When you score a critical hit. You inflict terror into your foes. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following; 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting a different attack type. 
 Once per round, when you score a critical hit, the affected creature gains 1 rank of fear.

name: Powerful Critical
description:
When you score a critical hit. The world recognizes who you are. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one of the following; 
 Ninjutsu attacks
 Taijutsu attacks
 Genjutsu attacks
 Critical Hits with the chosen attack type cannot be treated as a normal hit, ignores resistance and treats immunity as resistance.

name: Disgusting Critical
description:
When you score a critical hit. The environment and terrain bellows as sickening cry as your power. You gain the following benefits:
 Select one damage type from the following; 
 Acid
 Poison
 Necrotic
 You can take this feat more than once, each time selecting a different damage type. 
 Critical Hits with the chosen damage type ignores damage reduction.
 Once per round, when you score a critical hit, the affected creature gains 1 rank of corroded.
